required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gustatory Modulators Among a Sample of Depressed Egyptian Adults Under Anti-depressants Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Gustatory Modulators Among a Sample of Depressed Egyptian Adults Under Anti-depressants Therapy. A Retrospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: Identify possible modulators for developing gustatory dysfunction among a sample of depressed Egyptian adults (age from 20 to 50 years old) under anti-depressants therapy ( for at least 3 months) using a questionnaire ( appendix) with a binary measuring unit (yes/no).

detailed_description.textblock:
PECO
- P Population: depressed Egyptian adults under anti-depressants therapy
- E1 Exposure 1: commonly prescribed tricyclic antidepressants (Imipramine, Amitriptyline, Clomipramine HCL)
- E2 Exposure 2: commonly prescribed Selective Serotonin Re-uptake inhibitors antidepressants ( Fluoxetine, Fluvoxamine, Sertraline, Citalopram, Paroxetine)
- C control (non exposure) : non-pharmacological treatment ( psychotherapy)
- O Outcome: Identify possible gustatory dysfunction modulators among these patients using a questionnaire ( appendix) with a binary measuring unit (yes/no).

primary_outcome.time_frame: during a period of 7months from February 2020 till August 2020
primary_outcome.description: -C.M will use an assessment questionnaire (appendix) to assess possible modulators for developing gustatory dysfunction including a number of short-term and long-term factors such as body mass, gender, age, local and systemic diseases, excessive alcohol drinking, drug dependence, smoking, state of oral hygiene, consumption of some foods or drugs

arm_group.description: commonly prescribed tricyclic antidepressants (Imipramine, Amitriptyline, Clomipramine HCL) administered for at least 3 months
commonly prescribed Selective Serotonin Re-uptake inhibitors antidepressants ( Fluoxetine, Fluvoxamine, Sertraline, Citalopram, Paroxetine) administered for at least 3 months

study_pop.textblock: Depressed Egyptian adults under anti-depressants therapy The patients will be recalled using their phone numbers recorded in their follow up records in order to come to the Diagnosis center at the faculty of Dentistry, Cairo University to be assessed for possible gustatory dysfunction modulators and will be given identification numbers and divided into three groups, to which the operator shall be blinded.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- • Depressed Egyptian adults under antidepressants therapy for at least 3 months/non-pharmacological treatment( psychotherapy)
- Age from 20 to 50 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Antipsychotics
- Hypnotics
- Anticonvulsants
- Ages other than the mentioned • Olfactory dysfunction
- Chemosensory dysfunction
